intro: Sedum techinense, commonly known as the Mexican stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to Mexico. It features fleshy, upright stems and small, star-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow to orange. The plant has thick, water-storing leaves that help it survive in arid environments. It thrives in full sun and well-draining soil, making it a popular choice for rock gardens. Sedum techinense is also valued for its low maintenance and ability to tolerate drought conditions.
